alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:05PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Henry County in southeastern Alabama, Clay, Randolph, northwestern Calhoun, northwestern Early and Quitman Counties in southwestern Georgia through 415 PM EDT/315 PM CDT/... At 305 PM EDT/205 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Abbeville to 9 miles northwest of Blakely to near Edison. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Georgetown, Cuthbert, Edison, Bellville, Bluffton, Haleburg, Shorterville, Wire Bridge, Parksville, Carnegie, Hayes, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Ricks Place, Pecan, Thomas Mill Creek, Hatcher and Morris. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
